thread.title: Phillie Phanatic, 76ers mascot join dozens in rappelling 31 stories down city office building
thread.title_full: Phillie Phanatic, 76ers mascot join dozens in rappelling 31 stories down city office building - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Phillie Phanatic, 76ers mascot join dozens in rappelling 31 stories down city office building
text:
PHILADELPHIA - The Philadelphia Phillies finished the season in the cellar. But that didn't keep the Phanatic from engaging in some rooftop shenanigans.
The beloved team mascot rappelled 31 stories down the face of a skyscraper on Friday. That's a 418-foot drop.

The Philadelphia Phillies' mascot, the Phillie Phanatic, rappels down a skyscraper as part of a annual fundraiser Friday, Oct. 23, 2015, in Philadelphia. The event was a fundraiser for the Outward Bound School, which offers outdoor programs aimed at building character and leadership skills. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke) 
The event was a fundraiser for the Philadelphia Outward Bound School, which offers outdoor programs designed to build character and leadership skills.
Organizers aimed to have 100 people rappel during the all-day event. Mayor Michael Nutter was among them.
Four rope lines dangled from the 1 Logan Square office building as a rotating crowd of spectators cheered below. Participants had to raise at least $2,000 for Outward Bound.
Franklin, the furry blue canine who represents the Philadelphia 76ers, also took up the challenge.
